text: Ikenna Louis Obi (born 1976) is a Nigerian actor and film producer. He appeared in Shameful Deceit, for which he won Best Actor in a Supporting Role at the 5th BEFFTA UK Awards. ==Early life== Obi was born on 27 of December 1976 in Lagos, the last of four children. His father became ill and died at a young age. ==Career== Attended City Academy Drama School in London. ==Filmography== {|class="wikitable" |- align="center" !| Year !| Film !| Role !| Notes |- |rowspan=""| 2012 |International Games & International Attack 1 &2 | Actor | with Jackie Appiah & Rita Nzelu |- |rowspan="1"| 2013 | Shameful Deceit | Actor | with Eleanor Agala, Theodora Ibekwe & Collins Archie-Pearce |- |rowspan="1"| 2015 |Boxing Day | Actor | with Razaaq Adoti, Joseph Benjamin, Richard Mofe-Damijo & Yvonne Okoro |- |rowspan="1"| 2015 |Nana means King | Producer | |- |rowspan="1"| 2016 |Flight by Night | Producer | with Daniel Dahdah, Nana Obiri-Yeboah, & Sarah Ofori-Mensah |- |} ==Awards and nominations== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- !
